net.myorb.math

Class ExponentiationLib<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.math.SignManager
      • net.myorb.math.ComputationConfiguration<T>
        • net.myorb.math.Arithmetic<T>
          • net.myorb.math.ListOperations<T>
            • net.myorb.math.Tolerances<T>
              • net.myorb.math.ExponentiationLib<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type on which operations are to be executed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExtendedPowerLibrary<T>, PowerLibrary<T>, SignManagementOperations
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FactoredExponentiationLib, TrigLib

    public class ExponentiationLib<T>
extends Tolerances<T>
implements ExtendedPowerLibrary<T>
    library of exponentiation algorithms
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

      • lnNormalized

        public T lnNormalized(T x)
        compute natural logarithm of parameter value. normalize domain to 0.33 LT x LT 1 by powers of multiples of E. more cycles spent on normalizing to domain but result precision is higher on faster convergence of series
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as base of computation
        Returns:
        result of computation

      • lnInvertAndNegate

        public T lnInvertAndNegate(T x)
        compute natural logarithm of parameter value. faster normalization of domain 0 LT x LT 1 by using 1/x inversion and negation of result. less precision seen for values GT 3 due to slower convergence of series
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as base of computation
        Returns:
        result of computation

      • ln

        public T ln(T x)
        general natural logarithm calculation. domain reduced for x GT 1 by negation of ln(1/x)
        Specified by:
        ln in interface PowerLibrary<T>
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as base of computation
        Returns:
        result of computation

      • lnLessThan1

        public T lnLessThan1(T x)
        natural logarithm calculation for x LT 1. domain reduced further to x GT 1/3 to improve convergence speed
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as base of computation x LT 1
        Returns:
        result of computation
